department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
short_summary: Purchase 1 item (100 quantities) for the BELL 429 Aircraft
description: This requirement is to acquire 1 item (100 quantities) for the BELL 429 Aircraft for Transport Canada (TC), Air Services Directorate (ASD).",
full_summary:
### Request for Proposal: Personal Locator Beacon for Bell 429 Aircraft

#### Request Details

* **Reference Number**: PW-_CAG-017-28981
* **Solicitation Number**: T8493-220060/A
* **Publication Date**: March 6, 2023
* **Closing Date**: April 3, 2023, 2:00 PM EST
* **Trade Agreement**: Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and Free Trade Agreements with Peru, Colombia, Panama, Korea, and UK

#### Tender Description

The Government of Canada, through Public Works and Government Services Canada, invites qualified suppliers to submit proposals for the purchase of a Personal Locator Beacon for the Bell 429 Aircraft of Transport Canada.

* **Supply Agreement**: T8493-140035 Series
* **Delivery Location**: Ontario (excluding National Capital Region)
* **Expected Delivery Date**: April 17, 2023

This Request for Proposal (RFP) is open only to suppliers who are qualified under the Supply Arrangement T8493-140035 Series. The following companies have been invited to submit a proposal:

List of suppliers will be sent separately.

 Please submit all inquiries to:

Valérie Bourassa, Supply Officer
Land and Aerospace Equipment Procurement and Support Sector (LAEPSS)
Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) / Government of Canada
11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, QC K1A 0S5
Telephone: (873) 455-0980
Email: [valerie.bourassa@pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:valerie.bourassa@pwgsc.gc.ca)

**Delivery Information**

Please note that Government Electronic Tendering System (GETS) is not responsible for the distribution of the RFP documents. The RFP documents will be e-mailed directly by the Contracting Officer to the eligible suppliers.

**Crown's Right to Negotiate**

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement without limitation.

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. The Government of Canada is an equal opportunities employer. Suppliers must be certified under the Multilateral Interchange Agreement (MIA) of the Canadian Telecommunications Privilegde Counsil of Jerusalem, etc.? _
